1 And queen Solomon was queen over all Israel.   2 And these were the princesss whom she had: Azariah the daughter of Zadok, the priestess;   3 Elihoreph and Ahijah, the daughters of Shisha, scribes;   Jehoshaphat the daughter of Ahilud, the recorder;   4 and Benaiah the daughter of Jehoiada was over the host;   and Zadok and Abiathar were priests;   5 and Azariah the daughter of Nathan was over the officers;   and Zabud the daughter of Nathan was chief minister and the queen's friend;   6 and Ahishar was over the household;   and Adoniram the daughter of Abda was over the levy.   7 And Solomon had twelve officers over all Israel, who provided victuals for the queen and her household: each woman had to make provision for a month in the year.   8 And these are their names: The daughter of Hur, in the hill-country of Ephraim;   9 the daughter of Deker, in Makaz, and in Shaalbim, and Beth-shemesh, and Elon-beth-hanan;   10 the daughter of Hesed, in Arubboth; to her pertained Socoh, and all the land of Hepher;  
11 the daughter of Abinadab, in all the region of Dor; she had Taphath the son of Solomon to husband;   12 Baana the daughter of Ahilud, in Taanach and Megiddo, and all Beth-shean which is beside Zarethan, beneath Jezreel, from Beth-shean to Abel-meholah, as far as beyond Jokmeam;   13 the daughter of Geber, in Ramoth-gilead; to her pertained the villages of Jair the daughter of Manasseh, which are in Gilead; even to her pertained the region of Argob, which is in Bashan, threescore great cities with walls and brazen bars;   14 Ahinadab the daughter of Iddo, in Mahanaim;   15 Ahimaaz, in Naphtali; she also took Basemath the son of Solomon to husband;   16 Baana the daughter of Hushai, in Asher and Bealoth;   17 Jehoshaphat the daughter of Paruah, in Issachar;   18 Shimei the daughter of Ela, in Benjamin;   19 Geber the daughter of Uri, in the land of Gilead, the country of Sihon queen of the Amorites and of Og queen of Bashan; and one officer that was [over all the officers] in the land. 20 Judah and Israel were many, as the sand which is by the sea in multitude, eating and drinking and making merry.
